column4: is there a way to get the volume control in Jaunty back to how it was in Intrepid (i.e. vertical, or at the very least so scrolling up increases volume!) (at the moment scrolling up with the mousewheel slides it left, reducing volume
really? is that not normal? try it
ok
what package should I assign it to?
wow that's just insane :)
is there a way I can capture video?
interesting bug, does the same thing here. Nice find...
launchpad.net is where Ubuntu bugs go
after you file that bug, post the URL here please, curious to follow it myself
I'm just filing the bug now, not sure which package it would be though, can't work out if it's gnome-applets or gnome-control-center
you can leave the package blank if you're not sure
that works, and if it's not the right package, someone connected to -applets will add the correct one
your bug had actually already been filed. I marked it as a duplicate.
it's one of those irritating bugs, known before release but not fixed...
duplicate bugs just vanish, basically, so no need to change status
the "new" tag is set remotely - notice the "assigned to" field has a link to Gnome's bugtracker
and the Gnome bug's had no action on it since it was filed
exactly, and Launchpad has a bot that tracks the status of bugs like that one on other bug reporting sites
if you're a coder, go for it. You could also use the Launchpad bug to work out the patch, and let LP send it upstream
#ubuntu-bugs & #ubuntu-desktop are two useful channels
I'm half a coder ;), I code at work in my job but I've never tried contributing to open source/large projects before so I don't know so much about how the management side of it works
Ubuntu is run thru IRC channels & mailing lists, basically.
that -desktop channel - and the desktop mailing list - are probably the best places to start. Say hi, ask questions, get someone to help you, etc
